column4: ironcladlou; it the bios settings for the hard drive on auto or user?
ironcladlou;ask him/her to try to user settings
ironcladlou- the bios hard drive settings, change from auto to user, basically tell the system the specs of the hard drive so it won't auto-detect it. worth a shot
ironcladlou-is this an upgrade or fresh install of feisty?
ironcladlou- i had issues with using 2 western digital drives, the installation couldn't find them!! I had to use different manufacture
hmm... he HAS been trying to use 2 identical drives which led us here
unknown, let me ask him to check
having him give it a shot now
we absolutely couldnt get the dual drive setup to work, so we're starting over using just 1 drive with defaults to get moving
let me find out what kind of drives they are
the installer, gparted, fdisk all see them just fine
but grub refuses to boot them
i can't really check the menu.lst since he can't get in and can't seem to locate the mounted disk from the live cd
doubtful. he just rebooted to screw with the hdd settings, he'll be back soon and we'll go from there
messing with nix without a 2nd computer to surf the web is definitely risky business :)
